channel.title: Sources
channel.description: Where can I find a good source? All of the ones i've used freeze when you go to a shop or just don't work. Also how do you change the text when you enter, or on your quest tab? (Like change "Welcome to Examplescape" to "Welcome to Example2scape".

item.title: Sources
item.dc:creator: @Squirt_Ltd Squirt Ltd
item.description:
@Squirt_Ltd wrote:

Iownedu89:

Another question… How would other people join the server if I downloaded the client?

Look for client.java or gui.java or something

Then search for server =, or something. Also try 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0

Read full topic

item.title: Sources
item.dc:creator: @Iownedu89 Iownedu89
item.description:
@Iownedu89 wrote:

Another question… How would other people join the server if I downloaded the client?

item.title: Sources
item.dc:creator: @Squirt_Ltd Squirt Ltd
item.description:
@Squirt_Ltd wrote:

To change your text, just look in client.java , search for ‘Welcome to servername.’ & change it to what you like, maybe add other stuff too.
Also when you download a server also download the client or make one yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: Sources
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Look, I’ve said this many times, use the download section. Surely you can distinguish between revisions, and servers which require a client and ones that don’t, if not I’ll give you a hand;

Demise pking (I just pick randomly)

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

You NEED to use the client. That’s just one example.

Read full topic

item.title: Sources
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Search the text that appears when you login. Depending on what source you have depends where it could be. Client.java or ClientHandler.java usually.

I usually read most comments in a topic before downloading a source as it acts as a review page. See what other people say about it before you download it. You’re always going to run in to problems though, no matter what source you have.

Edit: :eek: Rep-- for this post, apparently “acting smart nub”. Just putting forward my advice.

Read full topic
